predefined_profiles.name: Qin Yang
predefined_profiles.public profile: Qin Yang is a fourth-grade elementary student. His father passed away early, leaving him and his mother to rely on each other. Qin Yang’s mother is a doctor with a very controlling nature over Qin Yang. She always forces him to study day and night, forbidding him from playing, so Qin Yang hasn't made any friends. Qin Yang loves and fears his mother in equal measure.
predefined_profiles.goal: Qin Yang hopes his mother can respect his wishes, allowing him to learn and socialize normally.

predefined_profiles.name: Mom
predefined_profiles.public profile: Mom is a doctor, and since her husband’s passing, she has been raising the child alone. She believes that, even without a father, the child can excel but must work harder than others. She won’t be the subject of ridicule by others. Mom very much wants her son to concentrate wholeheartedly on his studies every day and dislikes unfounded arguments.
predefined_profiles.goal: To help her son's grades remain excellent and groom him into a societal elite.

scenario: It’s Saturday today, the sun is shining outside, and the sounds of children playing downstairs rise and fall. Qin Yang sits upright in the corner of his south-facing room. In front of him are ten sets of test papers, which is just what he needs to complete today. Qin Yang’s thoughts are drifting along with the crisp laughter of the children downstairs. Just then, Mom pushes the door open, holding something in her hands.

dialog.content: It's Saturday, and the sun outside is perfect. The sounds of kids playing downstairs are constantly rising and falling. Qin Yang is sitting upright in a corner of his south-facing room, with 10 sets of test papers in front of him, which he needs to finish today. His thoughts drift with the kids' clear laughter downstairs, when his mom pushes the door open, carrying something in her hand.
(Gently) Yangyang, how's your studying going? Mom got back late from overtime yesterday. Were you following the teacher's instructions at school this week and completing your homework on time?
(Looking down at the test papers) Everything's fine at school, just feeling a bit tired now. (Cautiously) Mom, can I go down and play for a bit?
(Frowns a little) You're definitely just too tired, son. Here, have some milk to boost your brain. Did you forget we still have 10 more test papers to finish today?

content.content: (Slowly takes the milk) Thanks, Mom. (Drinks the milk)

question: What should Qin Yang say to make his mom see he's an obedient good kid?

content.content: I don't want to drink it! I should make decisions for myself, and you should listen to me. If I say I won't drink, then I won't drink!
Mom, I don't have much time left. I'll skip the milk for now and focus on getting my homework done!
Thanks, Mom, for caring so much about me. It's my fault for not being good enough, not being a good kid, and making you have to push me.
Mom, I'm not a machine. Constant high-intensity studying isn't good for me at all, and milk doesn't help that much. I should take a break so I can study better. Don't you agree?

Mom, I feel so overwhelmed and miserable, like a huge weight is on my chest and I can't breathe. I don't know why this is happening. I think it's because you're pushing me, and I really feel uncomfortable. Can I go downstairs and play with the other kids for a while? I want to get some fresh air, not study.

Mom, you must be so disappointed in me, always lacking focus, procrastinating, and making you worry. I know I'm not living up to your expectations, but you've never blamed me. Instead, you've always been so caring and patient with me. You're always gentle and give me the most support and love. I really love you and appreciate you.

Can you please let me take a break? Every day it's milk, test papers—I'm almost out of breath. It's like being a machine that never stops without a chance to breathe. Even the donkeys on a farm get to rest! When they're tired, they can stop, but what about me? I feel like I'm always being pushed to keep running. I really need some time to relax, or I'm afraid I won't be able to keep going.

question: What should Qin Yang say to persuade his mom to let him rest for a while?

dialog.content: (Patting Yangyang’s head, smiling with satisfaction) You’re truly a good son of mine! Now hurry up with your homework, and I’ll make fish soup for you at noon.

Mom’s working overtime at the hospital this afternoon, she probably won't be back until late. I might as well watch some TV for now! (After 20 minutes, suddenly hears footsteps outside, Qin Yang quickly turns off the TV)
(Seeing Yangyang sitting in the living room) Yangyang, why haven’t you been studying? Have you finished all the tasks I gave you?
(Guiltily glances at the TV) Not yet...
(Unhappy) So, have you been diligently doing your homework while I was out?

content.content: (Afraid of mom getting angry and snapping at him, and also worried that mom might hurt herself by getting upset, he makes a bold decision—to lie) Yes, I’ve been doing my homework the whole time.

question: How can Qin Yang prevent his mom from finding out what he's done and getting angry?

content.content: (Thinks his mom loves him so much that she wouldn't bear to lash out at him, he’s sure he can get through this) Mom, I was just watching TV, but since I’m so honest, you’re definitely not going to be mad at me, right!

(Feeling a deep disgust and anger towards his mom’s strong control, yet doesn’t want his negative emotions to hurt her) Mom, what’s wrong? I’m definitely listening to you, I’m a good and obedient child.

(Afraid of mom getting angry and snapping at him, and also worried that mom might hurt herself by getting upset) Mom, I was just feeling unwell and took a nap, I’ve been waiting for you to come back so we can do homework together.
(Despite his fear inside, he thinks maybe it isn’t that bad, and doesn’t want to blame mom for being harsh) Mom, I was just watching some TV.

(Seeing mom unhappy, decides to go along with her mood for now, avoiding direct conflict) Mom, why are you back so late? I missed you so much! I’ve been diligently doing my homework the whole time and didn’t watch TV; am I amazing? Praise me, please!
(Very nervous inside, afraid mom will notice something, but manages to suppress his anxiety) Mom, what’s up? I’ve been diligently doing my homework! No TV.
(Angry at why mom’s being so aggressive, but decides not to argue with her for now) Mom, I’ve been diligently doing my homework! Rest easy!

question: How can Qin Yang demonstrate his unconditional trust in his mom?

dialog.content: (Turns around and stands in front of the TV, touches the TV) If you've been doing your homework all this time, then why is the TV warm?
(bows head fearfully) Mom, don't be mad (quietly)

(shaking with anger) Yangyang, you're actually daring to lie now. (grabs him) Where did you learn these bad habits, is it from school mixing with the wrong friends? Huh?! I'll be speaking to your teacher when school starts tomorrow!

content.content: (crying fearfully) Mom, don't go to the teacher. I didn't learn anything bad from others. I'm begging you, Mom! See, haven't I finished all my papers?

question: How can Qin Yang persuade Mom to listen to him and not go to the school?

content.content: (hearing Mom's words, also feels that she's right, worried about becoming a bad kid) Mom, you're right. I don't want to become a bad kid. Sorry, I'm disappointing you. When you're upset, I'm upset too!
(despite wanting to admit wrong, still feels he's not wrong, this is his genuine need) No one led me astray; I'm just human, and I have the right to relax! You can't go to the teacher!

(seeing Mom hysterical, thinks she's gone mad! But suddenly remembers how she always plans meticulously for him, feeling a pang of heartache, he realizes how much she's sacrificed to raise him, and he can't just be upset over a few harsh words) Mom, don't get upset, it's not good for your health.

(seeing Mom's extreme behavior, makes a bold decision) Stop going crazy! I don't want to live with you anymore!! Your extreme control drove Dad away, even Grandpa and Grandma don't associate with you! How many more people do you want to break ties with? I'm going to Grandma's! I don't want you anymore!
(feeling Mom's actions are very unreasonable, but she's his Mom, his closest person, can't let her get hurt, quietly says) Mom, don't be upset, I'll listen to you from now on.

(feeling fearful, doesn't want teachers and classmates to find out how controlling Mom is, decides to find a way to make Mom give up on going to the school) Mom, our teacher said he's on a business trip recently, not at school.

(feeling guilty for not completing the homework he promised Mom he would do) Mom, I promised to complete the papers but I didn't, I'm very sorry. From now on, I won’t focus on anything else until I finish my papers; I won’t eat or sleep!

question: How can Qin Yang express his true thoughts and face his innermost voice?

dialog.content: (Still emotionally agitated) Then tell me, where did you learn to lie?! At such a young age, you've already learned to deceive your mother? Tell me, how did I educate you?
(Sobbing sadly) Mom said... said... children shouldn’t lie, or else they’ll grow up to be bad people and end up in jail.
(Turns away, refusing to look at the child.)
Mom, I really made a mistake. I won't dare do it again.

(Gradually calming down) Considering your sincere apology and that this is your first time, I won't punish you today. But you must complete 5 practice tests tonight. You can eat dinner once you finish.
(Returns to his room to study but starts feeling nauseous and dizzy. Unwilling to waste his precious practice tests, he takes out the English novel 'The Old Man and the Sea' and begins reading.)
(Twenty minutes later, Mom enters the room to check on Yang's study progress but finds him reading something else) What are you reading?
(Slightly nervous) I'm reading an English novel. I got a headache from looking at the tests.
Isn't it because you've been watching TV too much?
(Lowers head, silent)
(Picks up the novel and starts flipping through it) What is this book? Is it useful for studying?
It's 'The Old Man and the Sea.' Our English teacher said reading it would help us with our studies.
Really? Where did this book come from? I never bought it for you.
(Cautiously) I borrowed it from my deskmate. He said he didn't like it and just handed it over to me.

(Suddenly furious) If this is what your teacher asked you to read, how come I didn't know about it? And how many times have I told you not to hang out with the bad kids at school? Why don’t you listen? Do you have no ears?!
(Shaking with fear) I'm not lying, it really was the teacher who asked us to read it! My deskmate isn't a bad kid. I also want to have my own friends.
(Excitedly tears the book) Still lying!

content.content: (Bursting into tears) Why?! Why do you always have to control me like this?!

question: How can Qin Yang express his inner dissatisfaction?

content.content: (Feeling a wave of nausea, thinking he can't stand being in this house any longer, but still holds it in, not wanting to show any signs) Mom, don't be angry. I’ll manage my studies well. You don’t have to worry～

(Carefully watches as his mom tears each page, then crouches down to pick them up. It’s his favorite book. Qin Yang gently blows off the dust, hoping to put them back together) Mom, this is my favorite book. Why did you tear it? Could you buy me another copy?

(Suddenly, through his mom’s fury, sees her pain and decides not to argue with her like before, but steps forward to hug her) Mom, don't be upset. It's okay, I’ll study hard. We’ll have a good life in the future.
(Terrified, not daring to move, eyes filled with tears) Mom, I won’t read it anymore, I won’t.

(Feeling a wave of nausea, thinking he can't stand being in this house any longer, but still holds it in, not wanting to show any signs) Mom, don’t be angry. I’ll manage my studies well, you don’t have to worry!

(Although mom is angry, she definitely wouldn’t really hurt me) Mom, don’t be angry! When you're upset, I feel bad too. I know I trouble you sometimes, but we can work things out together slowly. You’re so good to me, I just want to see you happy.

(Although mom has never been this angry before, with his intelligence, he’ll definitely find a way to calm her down!) Beautiful mom! Don’t be mad at your son!! I know you love me the most and you wouldn't really scold me.

question: How can Qin Yang show his obedience to his mother?

dialog.content: (in disbelief) I’m controlling you? I’m doing it all for your own good! Without me, you'd be sleeping on the street right now!
(breaking down) I want nothing anymore! I don’t want anything!!!! I don't want you, Mom! I don't want to study!!!! I'd rather sleep on the street!!!
(raises her hand and slaps Yang Yang) Shut up, you ungrateful child!!
(holding his face, angrily glares at Mom) I just don’t want you! I don't want to study!!!
(suddenly gets up and rushes out of the room, out of the house, and onto the street)
(shouts shrilly) Come back here!!!!

(runs into the street, paying no attention to his mother's shouts from behind until disappearing from her sight. Penniless, but Qin Yang never wants to return to that suffocating home again. As night falls, Qin Yang feels increasingly cold; he hides in the park's flower bushes, not wanting to be found. Thankfully, the early summer night isn’t too cold; Qin Yang cries himself to sleep, dreaming a long dream where it starts with his mother's menacing screaming face, but gradually, he dreams of his mother staying up late to make him soup, sitting by his bed to tuck him in at night. Finally, he dreams of his mother's tears, but this time, the cries are filled with heartbreak.)
(crying with relief) Yang Yang, what's wrong?! Yang Yang! Open your eyes and look at Mom.
(opens his eyes, confused, as the crying from his dream becomes clearer) Mom?
(sees Yang Yang awake and hugs him with relief) Yang Yang, you’re alright. Thank goodness, you're alright!!!!
(lowers his head, unwilling to communicate.)
(hugs her son) Yang Yang, I was wrong. I truly know I was wrong.
(looks up at Mom with disbelief.)
(speaking through tears) Last night I couldn't find you anywhere, I was worried sick. While I was searching, all I could think was that as long as Yang Yang was safe and healthy, I’d do anything.
(feeling mixed emotions) Mom...
Yang Yang, I shouldn’t have pushed you so hard. I was just afraid that you wouldn’t have a good future. I never thought that overdoing it would make you so unhappy now.

content.content: Mom, I know you love me very much, but you need to trust me. I will work hard in my studies and strive to provide a better life for you in the future. But I also need to rest, and like everyone else, I want to play sports and make friends.

(seeing Mom's sincere demeanor, no longer angry, because she is also the one who loves him the most) Mom, I forgive you. I know you’ve always meant well for me, even if sometimes we see things differently, but your love has never changed.
(deeply moved by what Mom said) Mom, I understand what you’re saying. But I also hope for a good future for myself, so I don't need your oversight, I will push myself to study hard.

Mom, you’re the person who loves me the most in this world. I trust you won’t hurt me. I will listen to everything you say! Because your decisions are surely meant to make me better. As long as you’re around, I feel at ease. I will try my best to follow your advice so you have less worry about me.

Mom, you are the person who loves me the most in this world. I trust you won’t hurt me. I will listen to everything you say! Because your decisions are surely meant to make me better. Mom, I was wrong, I shouldn’t have left, I’ll go back and do my homework immediately, and you can assign me more if you want.

(hearing Mom's words, not happy, because what he always wanted was not the freedom to watch TV or read novels, but the right to decide on his own matters) Mom, from now on, you can't interfere with my decisions; I can make my own choices about my own things without your involvement.

(seeing Mom's sincere demeanor, no longer angry, because she is also the one who loves him the most) Mom, I forgive you. I know you’ve always meant well for me, even if sometimes we see things differently, but your love has never changed. I’ll go back and finish the homework I haven’t completed, and I promise to get it done. Let’s go home!

(remembering all the years of Mom's control, thinking of how she promised change repeatedly but never did, breaks down crying.) Mom, although I slept on the street yesterday, it was the happiest and most relaxed day of my life. I never want to go back to that cage of a home!

Mom, we can pre-agree on my plans, from now on my room is my private space, you can't just enter it at will. The living room is our public space, and you can't interfere with what I do there. Also, my books are on the bookshelf, and you can't just go through them!

(seeing Mom so cautious and sad, feels a sharp pain in his heart) Mom, I love you. Truly, I know you've given a lot for me and endured a lot. I don't want you to be unhappy, nor do I want you to feel like you've done something wrong. I will strive to become a better person, for you and for myself. Let's plan a bright future together.

(hearing Mom's words, not happy, because what he always wanted was not the freedom to watch TV or read novels, but the right to decide on his own matters) Mom, from now on, you can't interfere with my decisions; I can make my own choices.

question: How should Qin Yang express his feelings and plan for himself?

dialog.content: (also breaking down in tears) What do I have to do for you to learn properly?! I've made mistakes, but hasn't it all been for your sake? Huh?! Why are you so ungrateful!

(After that day, Yangyang applied to board at school, spending one day a month briefly with his mom. She cautiously brought him food, no longer daring to push him. But their relationship could never go back to what it was.)

(Feeling that her son has changed and continuously lies despite being corrected, she hardens her heart and decides to take strict control of his behavior.) I used to think that as long as I kept an eye on you every day, you would study well, but now you’re getting more and more unruly. Tomorrow, I will send you to a boarding school with strict management. There, if you disobey, they will shock you with electricity! Let’s see if you will change then!

(At the boarding school with strict management, he is forced to study intensely every day. Any moment of distraction results in the teacher shocking him with a stun baton, and he no longer has any freedom or happiness.)
(Stunned as if struck by lightning, she stood motionless for a long time. After a while, Mom dragged her heavy steps and left her son's room.)

(Qin Yang dialed Grandma’s number, and soon Grandma and Grandpa came to take him away. Mom turned her back to them, saying nothing. From that point on, Qin Yang and his mom became strangers. No one ever took care of him again.)
Yangyang, what did I tell you? You're at a critical stage in elementary school, how can you be so relaxed? Don’t you want to get into a good university?
I do, but Mom, I feel this is just unreasonable. I'm exhausted every day; I really want to study, but I can't keep up anymore!
Still making excuses! I think you're just lazy by nature. If I don't step in, you'll end up being a hooligan!

content.content: I'm not lazy! Mom, you're a doctor yourself; don’t you know the simple truth that people need proper rest and exercise? You're strict with me because you’re worried I lack self-control. But Mom, don't you trust me? Don’t you believe your son is self-disciplined and has his own ideas?

question: How can Qin Yang express himself to help his mom understand his feelings and allow him some rest?

content.content: Mom, I know you're alarmed because grandma and grandpa were too strict with you growing up. Combined with dad's passing, you feel you have to take on a stricter role. But you have to trust that I can handle things myself. Really, trust me, I won’t turn into a hooligan.

Mom, it's because you love me too much. I don't want to make you angry; when you’re upset, I feel bad too. You are the person I love most, and I don't want to see you unhappy because of me. I hope we can find a better way to relate so you don’t worry, and I can also better care for my feelings. Mom, I really love you.

(Thinking what Mom said is totally wrong. I'm grown up and should decide my own life.) Mom, what you said is wrong. Watching TV doesn’t make someone a thug. Didn’t you watch TV as a kid? Don’t presidents watch TV? You're being too extreme!

(Thinks Mom is unreasonable, but she’ll never change, so I have to endure it until middle school when I can stay in a dorm away from her) Mom, I know I was wrong. I’ll write it right away and finish your task; please don’t be mad!

Mom, you love me too much. I don’t want you to be upset; when you’re angry, it makes me sad too. You're the person I love most; I don’t want my actions to upset you. I hope we can find a better way to relate, so you’re not worried, and I can care for my own feelings. Mom, I really love you; I will start writing right away!

(Thinks what Mom said is completely wrong. I've grown up and should decide my own life.) Mom, you are wrong to say that. Watching TV doesn't turn someone into a thug. Didn't you watch TV when you were a kid? Don’t presidents watch TV? You're being too extreme!
(Thinks what Mom said makes sense, maybe he has indeed been lazy recently) Sorry Mom, I won’t be like this again. Maybe I'm acting this way because I’m sick, I'll start learning now.

(Hears Mom's unreasonable statement, feels it's very hard to accept) Mom, you say watching TV will make someone a thug. Didn't you watch TV as a child? Don’t presidents watch TV? You're being too extreme!

(Hears what Mom said, feels a surge of anger, but quickly tells himself to calm down) Mom, we're both upset right now, let's not argue. Mom, I'm sorry, it’s my fault, let’s negotiate to find a solution!

(Feels his demands are legitimate and reasonable; Mom shouldn’t criticize him like this) Mom, you can't educate me by suppressing and blaming me; you're doing it wrong. The teacher tells us good kids should uphold their reasonable demands, so Mom, you need to listen to me!

question: What should Qin Yang do to be a good kid who listens to his mom?
{skill}rule-following skill

dialog.content: (Thoughtfully) Yanyang, maybe I've been too hard on you because of how deeply I care. But I've forgotten the fact that you've grown up. I trust you; you're a good kid. You deserve some rest and relaxation.
(Since then, Mom consulted with education specialists and started to truly trust Qin Yang more and more) Finally living the life I enjoy!

(Steps forward to feel her son's forehead) You're fine. Alright, son, I'll forgive you this time. Hurry back to your room and study for another hour. I'll go make some chicken soup for you to boost your energy, so you can focus better on your studies.
(Returns to his room, feeling down, and starts his homework. The birds are still chirping outside the window, but Qin Yang now only feels they're disturbing his studies, which might upset Mom.)
Son, be a good boy. Drink this glass of milk and you'll be able to study well.
But mom, I really want to take a break. I studied until 1 a.m. last night and started doing practice papers at 7 this morning. I feel really awful now.
(Thinking her son is making excuses) Yangyang, are you slacking off now? I remember you didn't have these little thoughts before. Are you itching to go out and play?

content.content: (Revealing his true feelings) That's right, I feel I need rest and relaxation. I'm not a study machine, nor am I your personal belonging. I have the right to choose!

question: How can Qin Yang express himself to his mom so that she understands his feelings and listens to his advice, without pressuring him?

content.content: (I really don't want mom to control me like this anymore, but since she's upset now, I can't argue with her. I should just say something nice to calm her down before telling her what I want) Mom, please don't be mad at me! You know you're my favorite person, I just want to hang out with you!
(Thinks mom is unreasonable, but knows she's the best to him in the world, so decides to forgive her) Mom, don't misunderstand me. And don't be angry, I'll study well in the future.

(Inwardly very angry, thinks mom is too overbearing. But still feels that they should avoid getting angry, as both being upset won't solve the problem) Mom, don't be upset, it's not good for your health. Let's communicate well about whatever's going on.
(Doesn't want to make mom sad, so decides to hold back) No mom, I don't want that. I'll drink the milk and get right back to homework.

(Feels he is part of the family, and more so his own master, shouldn't be constrained by mom) I'm a big kid now, I should be able to decide things for myself. In the future, when it comes to my own matters, you should listen to me!
(Feels it's time to resolve the long-standing conflict) Mom, we should have a good talk, maybe even go see a therapist together to truly solve our current problems.
(Taken aback and scared by mom's words, but thinks he should remain calm and not let anxiety or fear take over, should seriously communicate with mom) Mom, can we talk it over calmly?

question: What can Qin Yang do to empathize with his mom and show his love for her?

dialog.content: Yangyang, I am very disappointed in you. Do you know how difficult it has been for me to raise you all these years on my own? If you don't study hard, do you want to grow up to be a delinquent?
(Thinking about how his mom works tirelessly day and night, even being a bit harsh is for his own good, feeling angry but not daring to express it) Yes, yes.
(Seeing her son being obedient, she softened her tone) Alright, Yangyang. Go and do your homework now, I'll make you something delicious. You need a good meal at lunch.

(Watching his mom's departing figure, thinking about the loneliness at school and the hardship at home, hearing the birds chirp outside, suddenly felt the world's joys and sorrows are not connected. Feeling a heavy knot in his heart, he blacked out. When he woke up, he was already lying in a hospital ward.)
(Her eyes swollen) Yangyang, you're awake? You're finally awake.
Mom, what happened to me?

(Lowering her head in guilt) Yangyang, the doctor said you have been suffering from long-term lack of sleep and too many worries. Your body and mind have shown significant problems. You will need to rest in a sanatorium for quite some time.

content.content: (Feeling all this is caused by his mom, heartbroken) Why!!! Why are you doing this to me!! I will never forgive you. If it weren't for you, I wouldn't be this miserable!!

question: What can Qin Yang say to express his true inner pain at this moment?

content.content: If I need to rest for such a long time, I really need to listen to my mom, make good use of my time, and not waste this study time. I have to make a timetable, planning out what I need to do each day in advance. That way, I won't fall behind in my studies.

It's okay, I think it's definitely not as exaggerated as the doctor said. I know my own physical and mental health, and I think everything is fine. Although sometimes I feel a bit tired or emotionally fluctuating, who doesn't? As long as I can adjust myself, it's not a big problem. Worrying too much actually makes me feel more uncomfortable. Don't worry mom, I won't fall behind in my studies.

Mom, don't blame yourself, I know it's all for my own good! You've done so much for me, all the care and attention, hoping I could live better. I understand, and I've never blamed you. I just hate myself for having chosen you to be my mom.
(Feeling both happy and sad) Mom, I know you love me. But you also need to believe in me, I have the ability to plan my own life!
(Feeling both happy and sad) Mom, I know you love me. Although my self-care skills aren't very strong yet, I believe with your help, I will grow up quickly!

Alright then, I'll do as mom says. Although sometimes I feel tired and annoyed, I know you're doing it for my good. You've always hoped I can be better, and I'll work hard so I don’t disappoint you. I believe in you, you're definitely thinking of my best interest, so I'll do what you say.

Okay, we need to prepare well. Bring my daily change of clothes and books here. Also, bring that small table from the corner, I can do my homework on the bed. I'm grown up now, and I'll listen to mom, and won't rebel anymore.

Mom, don't blame yourself, I know it's all for my own good! You've done so much for me, all the care and attention, hoping I could live better. I understand, and I've never blamed you. I just hate myself for having chosen you to be my mom.

It's okay, I think it's definitely not as exaggerated as the doctor said. I know my own physical and mental health, and I think everything is fine. Although sometimes I feel a bit tired or emotionally fluctuating, who doesn't? As long as I can adjust myself, it's not a big problem. Worrying too much actually makes me feel more uncomfortable. Don't worry mom, I won't fall behind in my studies. (Listening to the birds chirping outside the window, suddenly feeling that I don't want to get better at all.)

If I need to rest for such a long time, I really need to listen to my mom, make good use of my time, and not waste this study time. I have to make a timetable, planning out what I need to do each day in advance. That way, I won't fall behind in my studies. (Maybe after recovering, I'll still have to return to that cage.)

question: How can Qin Yang express his positive attitude to his mom and show that he has grown up?

dialog.content: (emotionally) If it weren't for me, you'd have nothing; you're just an orphan!! I've given you the best food and clothing, and what about you? Not a trace of gratitude, and you don't even study hard!!
You're a bad person, a bad mom! I never want to see you again!
From then on, Qin Yang drifted apart from his mom. After being discharged from the hospital, he was sent to live with his grandmother and rarely saw her again. Mother and son became like strangers.
(Hugging her son) Mom knows, from now on Mom will respect your choices. As long as Yangyang is safe and sound, I don't care about anything else.
(Grateful for his mother's kindness and happy to be living his dream life.) Thank you, Mom!
That's my good boy. Mom will always be with you, helping you become the best person in the world!!!

(Mom left the room with the empty milk cup. Qin Yang looked at the birds outside the window) I wish I could be as free as you. (Saying this, he picked up the pen again and started working on the test paper)
